\subsubsection[{float\-\_\-equals}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}bool chaos\-::math\-::float\-\_\-equals (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{float}]{a, }
\item[{float}]{b, }
\item[{float}]{delta\-\_\-threshold = {\ttfamily FLT\-\_\-EPSILON}, }
\item[{{\bf chaos\-::uint32}}]{ulps\-\_\-threshold = {\ttfamily 8}}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{namespacechaos_1_1math_a45b789648ddacd3e1d2403834c1953a6}


Checks whether two floating point values are equal or almost equal. 

This performs a two stage check\-:


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item First the values are subtracted from one another and if the absolute result is less than or equal to {\ttfamily delta\-\_\-threshold} then this operation resolves true.
\item Second the integer representations of the values are subtracted from one another and if the absolute result is less than or equal to {\ttfamily ulps\-\_\-threshold} then this function resolves true.
\end{DoxyItemize}

The first check is performed for the purpose of values near 0 where U\-L\-Ps style comparisons break down, e.\-g. {\ttfamily 0.\-0\-F == -\/0.\-0\-F}.

The second comparison is a comparison of the difference of units in last place (U\-L\-Ps) between the two floats. This effectively compares the number of possible float representations between the two values. Larger numbers with less precision will have a bigger numerical difference than two smaller values with more precision for the same U\-L\-Ps difference.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em a} & The first float to compare. \\
\hline
{\em b} & The second float to compare. \\
\hline
{\em delta\-\_\-threshold} & If {\ttfamily a} and {\ttfamily b} have a difference less than or equal to this, they are considered equal. \\
\hline
{\em ulps\-\_\-threshold} & If {\ttfamily a} and {\ttfamily b} have units in last place difference less than or equal to this, they are considered equal. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
